trans-unit.source: How to install MySQL on Azure
trans-unit.target: How to install MySQL on Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install the MySQL stack on a Linux virtual machine (VM) in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install the MySQL stack on a Linux virtual machine (VM) in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can install on Ubuntu or RedHat family OS.
trans-unit.target: You can install on Ubuntu or RedHat family OS.

trans-unit.source: How to install MySQL on Azure
trans-unit.target: How to install MySQL on Azure

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to install and configure MySQL on an Azure virtual machine running Linux.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to install and configure MySQL on an Azure virtual machine running Linux.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] You must already have a Microsoft Azure virtual machine running Linux in order to complete this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] You must already have a Microsoft Azure virtual machine running Linux in order to complete this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Please see the [Azure Linux VM tutorial](virtual-machines-linux-tutorial.md) to create and set up a Linux VM with `mysqlnode` as the VM name and `azureuser` as user before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: Please see the [Azure Linux VM tutorial](virtual-machines-linux-tutorial.md) to create and set up a Linux VM with `mysqlnode` as the VM name and `azureuser` as user before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: [In this case, use 3306 port as the MySQL port.] ##Install MySQL on your virtual machine Connect to the Linux VM you created via putty.
trans-unit.target: [In this case, use 3306 port as the MySQL port.] ##Install MySQL on your virtual machine Connect to the Linux VM you created via putty.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you use Azure Linux VM, see how to use putty connect to a Linux VM [here](virtual-machines-linux-use-ssh-key.md).
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you use Azure Linux VM, see how to use putty connect to a Linux VM [here](virtual-machines-linux-use-ssh-key.md).

trans-unit.source: We will use repository package to install MySQL5.6 as an example in this article.
trans-unit.target: We will use repository package to install MySQL5.6 as an example in this article.

trans-unit.source: Actually, MySQL5.6 has more improvement in performance than MySQL5.5.
trans-unit.target: Actually, MySQL5.6 has more improvement in performance than MySQL5.5.

trans-unit.source: More information [here](http://www.mysqlperformanceblog.com/2013/02/18/is-mysql-5-6-slower-than-mysql-5-5/).
trans-unit.target: More information [here](http://www.mysqlperformanceblog.com/2013/02/18/is-mysql-5-6-slower-than-mysql-5-5/).

trans-unit.source: ###How to install MySQL5.6 on Ubuntu We will use Linux VM with Ubuntu from Azure here.
trans-unit.target: ###How to install MySQL5.6 on Ubuntu We will use Linux VM with Ubuntu from Azure here.

trans-unit.source: - Step 1: Install MySQL Server 5.6
trans-unit.target: - Step 1: Install MySQL Server 5.6

trans-unit.source: Switch to `root` user: #[azureuser@mysqlnode:~]sudo su - Install mysql-server 5.6: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# apt-get update #[root@mysqlnode ~]# apt-get -y install mysql-server-5.6 During installation, you will see a dialog window poping up to ask you to set MySQL root password below, and you need set the password here. ![image](./media/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql-p1.png) Input the password again to confirm. ![image](./media/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql-p2.png) - Step 2: Login MySQL Server When MySQL server installation finished, MySQL service will be started automatically.
trans-unit.target: Switch to `root` user: #[azureuser@mysqlnode:~]sudo su - Install mysql-server 5.6: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# apt-get update #[root@mysqlnode ~]# apt-get -y install mysql-server-5.6 During installation, you will see a dialog window poping up to ask you to set MySQL root password below, and you need set the password here. ![image](./media/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql-p1.png) Input the password again to confirm. ![image](./media/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql/virtual-machines-linux-install-mysql-p2.png) - Step 2: Login MySQL Server When MySQL server installation finished, MySQL service will be started automatically.

trans-unit.source: You can login MySQL Server with `root` user.
trans-unit.target: You can login MySQL Server with `root` user.

trans-unit.source: Use the below command to login and input password.
trans-unit.target: Use the below command to login and input password.

trans-unit.source: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# mysql -uroot -p - Step 3: Manage the running MySQL service (a) Get status of MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql status (b) Start MySQL Service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql start (c) Stop MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql stop (d) Restart the MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql restart ###How to install MySQL on Red Hat OS family like CentOS, Oracle Linux We will use Linux VM with CentOS or Oracle Linux here.
trans-unit.target: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# mysql -uroot -p - Step 3: Manage the running MySQL service (a) Get status of MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql status (b) Start MySQL Service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql start (c) Stop MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql stop (d) Restart the MySQL service #[root@mysqlnode ~]# service mysql restart ###How to install MySQL on Red Hat OS family like CentOS, Oracle Linux We will use Linux VM with CentOS or Oracle Linux here.

trans-unit.source: - Step 1: Add the MySQL Yum repository Switch to `root` user: #[azureuser@mysqlnode:~]sudo su - Download and install the MySQL release package: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# wget http://repo.mysql.com/mysql-community-release-el6-5.noarch.rpm #[root@mysqlnode ~]# yum localinstall -y mysql-community-release-el6-5.noarch.rpm - Step 2: Edit below file to enable the MySQL repository for downloading the MySQL5.6 package.
trans-unit.target: - Step 1: Add the MySQL Yum repository Switch to `root` user: #[azureuser@mysqlnode:~]sudo su - Download and install the MySQL release package: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# wget http://repo.mysql.com/mysql-community-release-el6-5.noarch.rpm #[root@mysqlnode ~]# yum localinstall -y mysql-community-release-el6-5.noarch.rpm - Step 2: Edit below file to enable the MySQL repository for downloading the MySQL5.6 package.

trans-unit.source: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# vim /etc/yum.repos.d/mysql-community.repo Update each value of this file to below: \# *Enable to use MySQL 5.6* [mysql56-community] name=MySQL 5.6 Community Server baseurl=http://repo.mysql.com/yum/mysql-5.6-community/el/6/$basearch/ enabled=1 gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=file:/etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-mysql - Step 3: Install MySQL from MySQL repository Install MySQL: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#yum install mysql-community-server MySQL RPM package and all related packages will be installed.
trans-unit.target: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# vim /etc/yum.repos.d/mysql-community.repo Update each value of this file to below: \# *Enable to use MySQL 5.6* [mysql56-community] name=MySQL 5.6 Community Server baseurl=http://repo.mysql.com/yum/mysql-5.6-community/el/6/$basearch/ enabled=1 gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=file:/etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-mysql - Step 3: Install MySQL from MySQL repository Install MySQL: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#yum install mysql-community-server MySQL RPM package and all related packages will be installed.

trans-unit.source: - Step 4: Manage the running MySQL service
trans-unit.target: - Step 4: Manage the running MySQL service

trans-unit.source: (a) Check the service status of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld status (b) Check whether the default port of MySQL server is running: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#netstat –tunlp|grep 3306
trans-unit.target: (a) Check the service status of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld status (b) Check whether the default port of MySQL server is running: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#netstat –tunlp|grep 3306

trans-unit.source: (c) Start the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld start (d) Stop the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld stop (e) Set MySQL to start when the system boot-up: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#chkconfig mysqld on ###How to install MySQL on SUSE Linux We will use Linux VM with OpenSUSE here.
trans-unit.target: (c) Start the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld start (d) Stop the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#service mysqld stop (e) Set MySQL to start when the system boot-up: #[root@mysqlnode ~]#chkconfig mysqld on ###How to install MySQL on SUSE Linux We will use Linux VM with OpenSUSE here.

trans-unit.source: - Step 1: Download and install MySQL Server
trans-unit.target: - Step 1: Download and install MySQL Server

trans-unit.source: Switch to `root` user through below command: #sudo su - Download and install MySQL package: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# zypper update #[root@mysqlnode ~]# zypper install mysql-server mysql-devel mysql - Step 2: Manage the running MySQL service
trans-unit.target: Switch to `root` user through below command: #sudo su - Download and install MySQL package: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# zypper update #[root@mysqlnode ~]# zypper install mysql-server mysql-devel mysql - Step 2: Manage the running MySQL service

trans-unit.source: (a) Check the status of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql status (b) Check whether the default port of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# netstat –tunlp|grep 3306 (c) Start the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql start (d) Stop the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql stop (e) Set MySQL to start when the system boot-up: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# insserv mysql ###Next Step Find more usage and information regarding MySQL [Here](https://www.mysql.com/).
trans-unit.target: (a) Check the status of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql status (b) Check whether the default port of the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# netstat –tunlp|grep 3306 (c) Start the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql start (d) Stop the MySQL server: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# rcmysql stop (e) Set MySQL to start when the system boot-up: #[root@mysqlnode ~]# insserv mysql ###Next Step Find more usage and information regarding MySQL [Here](https://www.mysql.com/).
